news_insight_text_link.news_insight_description: Hexafarms, based in Berlin, Germany, secured €1.3 million in pre-seed funding to advance its AI and sensor technology for indoor farming. This investment aims to enhance operational efficiency and food production in greenhouses across Europe. The funding round was led by Speedinvest.

about_short_description.short_description: Hexafarms offers a SaaS that enables greenhouses and vertical indoor farms to save on their operations and production.

product.name: Climate Control Integration
product.description: Hexafarms' system connects with existing climate computers and sensors in greenhouses, allowing for real-time monitoring and adjustments to optimize growing conditions.

product.name: Yield Forecasting
product.description: The service provides yield forecasts three weeks in advance by analyzing over 80 parameters and camera images, enabling accurate planning for greenhouse operations.

product.name: Disease and Pest Management
product.description: Offers strategies to prevent disease and pest outbreaks, including detection of dry spots and optimization of LED setups, contributing to healthier crop production.

product.name: Production Optimization
product.description: Personalized optimization strategies are provided to improve harvest outcomes, including energy and human resource consumption overviews and production scheduling.

product.name: Sensor Technology
product.description: Hexafarms can retrofit and maintain all necessary sensors and cameras for monitoring and optimizing greenhouse environments, with no additional costs for sensor setup.

product.name: Harvest Consultation
product.description: Access to in-house harvest consultants for tailored advice on increasing yield and managing plant health, available 24/7.
